title: Prince Edward hailed online for his extraordinary cake cutting style with fans calling him 'amazing'
text:
Royal fans are demanding that Prince Edward be given 'more engagements' after a video was shared online of the royal flamboyantly cutting into a cake during an engagement.

The Earl of Wessex, 55, was visiting the Lakeland Community Care Centre in Northern Ireland when he was asked to cut a special 25th anniversary cake.

Father-of-two Edward dramatically jabbed the knife in the air above the cake several times before plunging it in and flamboyantly jolting it through the sponge.

The Royal Family's official Twitter account shared a clip of the moment, as the Queen's youngest son appeared to take sheer delight in the action, brandishing the knife before slicing into the cake with vigor.

Social media users hailed the move as 'brilliant', with one saying: 'He is amazing and he needs more engagements.'

Prince Edward, 55, was praised online after a clip of him cutting a cake in a flamboyant style during a royal visit went viral

Social media users praised Prince Edward for his 'cake cutting skills' after the official Royal Family Twitter account shared the clip

The royal is currently on a two-day visit to Northern Ireland, which started in County Fermanagh yesterday.

He met primary schoolchildren from County Cavan at Florence Court before meeting staff and volunteers from conservation charity, the National Trust.

He then went on to Lakeland Community Care Centre, where he joined in celebrations of their 25th anniversary.

The short clip quickly wracked up thousands of likes on Twitter viral after the Royal Family shared the video on their official account.

Prince Edward poised above the cake before dramatically slicing into the baked treat at the Lakeland Community Centre in Northern Ireland

The Earl of Wessex sliced into the anniversary cake with a flourish which impressed those at the royal visit

The official Twitter account called the Earl of Wessex's elaborate cake cutting 'a happy moment' during the royal visit

Alongside the clip, they wrote: 'It was a happy moment for members of the local community and volunteers at Lakeland Community Care Centre, as The Earl of Wessex joined them in celebrating their 25th anniversary!'

Lakeland Community Care Centre provides a variety of care for rural Fermanagh residents and offers space for social and sport activities.

The Earl of Wessex was given a tour of the community garden and met with members of the ‘men’s shed’.

The shed provides a space for men to chat and take part in practical activities; in the hope of reducing loneliness and isolation.

Social media users called the moment 'hilarious' online, with one writing: 'I love the enthusiasm Prince Edward brings to his duties'

Social media users reacted with delight to the clip of Prince Edward, with one royal fan writing: 'I love the enthusiasm Prince Edward brings to his duties. Look at his cake cutting skills.'

One wrote: 'He is amazing and he needs more engagements.'

Another commented: 'An unusual style but then I suppose if your job included repeated official cake cuttings, you might want to mix it up.'

Another added: 'This is a man who has never cut cake before.'
description: Prince Edward, 55, delighted social media with footage of him enthusiastically cutting a cake at the Lakeland Community Centre during a royal visit to Northern Ireland yesterday.
